text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . also use GitHub Actions re-render README.Rmd every time push. example workflow can found : https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/v1/examples. can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(trout.modlR) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

title: Get Biomass Data — get_biomass_data
text: get_biomass_data can used extract biomass data .rdat model outputs. can used extract data single model, multiple models, calculate sum biomass models.

title: Get Biomass Data — get_biomass_data
code: get_biomass_data(   dat1,   dat2 = NULL,   dat3 = NULL,   grouping = c("year", "data_type"),   cumulative = FALSE,   pounds = TRUE )

title: Get Biomass Data — get_biomass_data
text: dat1 rdat file containing model output dat2 rdat file containing model output dat3 rdat file containing model output grouping Grouping parameters. determines groups used sum biomass cumulative = TRUE. Options include "year","data_type", "mu","species". cumulative TRUE FALSE(default).  TRUE, sum biomass models output. pounds TRUE FALSE.  TRUE, converts kg's pounds. wide TRUE FALSE. TRUE, output data wide format

title: Get Biomass Data — get_biomass_data
text: tibble

title: Get Biomass Data — get_biomass_data
code: get_biomass_data(trout1) #> # A tibble: 70 x 5 #>     year result data_type species    mu    #>    <int>  <dbl> <fct>     <chr>      <chr> #>  1  1985  1435. Total     Lake Trout MM-67 #>  2  1986  1640. Total     Lake Trout MM-67 #>  3  1987  1729. Total     Lake Trout MM-67 #>  4  1988  1583. Total     Lake Trout MM-67 #>  5  1989  1462. Total     Lake Trout MM-67 #>  6  1990  1335. Total     Lake Trout MM-67 #>  7  1991  1209. Total     Lake Trout MM-67 #>  8  1992   938. Total     Lake Trout MM-67 #>  9  1993   887. Total     Lake Trout MM-67 #> 10  1994   865. Total     Lake Trout MM-67 #> # ... with 60 more rows get_biomass_data(trout1,trout2,grouping = c("data_type","mu"), cumulative = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 2 x 3 #> # Groups:   data_type [2] #>   data_type             mu    result #>   <fct>                 <chr>  <dbl> #> 1 Total                 MM-67 70844. #> 2 Female Spawning Stock MM-67 15646.

title: Get Parameter — get_parameter
text: get_parameter parses .rdat data output ADMB model. get_parameter can retrieve single parameter time. function used within get_parameters retrieve multiple parameters. Available options param_name can found parameter_names.

title: Get Parameter — get_parameter
text: dat .rdat file param_name character object specifying parameter name. See parameter_names details.

title: Get Parameter — get_parameter
text: Data specified param_nam.  can list, data.frame, integer, data types.

title: Get model Parameters — get_parameters
text: get_parameters parses .rdat data output ADMB model.  function accepts vector parameter names, parses data, outputs list. Available optiuons param_name can found parameter_names.

title: Get model Parameters — get_parameters
text: dat list param_name parameter name (s)

title: Get model Parameters — get_parameters
text: list

title: Make Biomass Plot — make_bmsPlots
text: make_bmsPlot plots biomass given model models.  Different graphs can output using 'type' argument.

title: Make Biomass Plot — make_bmsPlots
code: make_bmsPlots(   dat1,   dat2 = NULL,   dat3 = NULL,   title = NULL,   ymax = NULL,   type = "single",   plotly = FALSE )

title: Make Biomass Plot — make_bmsPlots
text: dat1 .rdat containing ADMB output dat2 .rdat containing ADMB output dat3 .rdat containing ADMB output title character object containing plot title. left NULL (default), title automatically generated ymax number representing max y-axis. left null(default), chosen automatically. type "single","multiple", "cumulative". determines type plot produced. "single" selected model results plotted individual model. supply '.rdat' object 'dat1' using 'single'. 'multiple' argument add biomass data multiple models one plot. 'cumulative' type produce stacked area plot containing biomass multiple models. 'cumulative' 'multiple' specified, pass additional '.rdat' files 'dat2' /'dat3' plotly TRUE FALSE (default). TRUE, plotly::ggplotly() object returned.

title: Make Biomass Plot — make_bmsPlots
text: ggplot2::ggplot() plotly::ggplotly() object

title: Make Biomass Plot — make_bmsPlots
code: make_bmsPlots(dat1 = trout1,type = 'single')  make_bmsPlots(dat1 = trout1,dat2 = trout2, type = 'multiple')  make_bmsPlots(dat1 = trout1,dat2 = trout2, type = 'cumulative')
